quest.name: A Final Peace
journal: Gosetsu has been given much to consider...

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: This has been an educational experience, to say the least...

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Yet everything we have learned is common knowledge to the people of the Steppe. 'Twill not be enough to earn our comrades their freedom.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Naught less than the Dotharl's plans for the Naadam will suffice, I fear.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Well, I have never been one for skulking about. I will go to Sadu and see what secrets I can prise from her lips!

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: The spies return. And they have learned naught.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Mayhap so, but no longer! Though you hide it well, I know you have devised some manner of cunning stratagem for the Naadam! Out with it, I say!

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: We are what you see, Doman. We are Dotharl.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Others rely on tricks and traps. Subterfuge. Lies. We have need of naught but our own strength. We meet the enemy in battle and kill him.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: That is why I cared not what you did from the first. There is naught for you to learn. Tell your masters to meet us on the field, and make ready to ride with their ancestors.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: ...Your confidence is plain, as is your strength.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Yet you are not the most prosperous of tribes. The Mol you mock are few, but so too are you. Why?

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: ...Though a glorious death is to be celebrated, it is yet death.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: While we kill many, many are killed in turn. In the wake of our battles, the soil drinks deep of the blood of the fallen, their bodies piled high.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Not all are born again. Only the bravest. Yet one cannot return unless there is a vessel to inherit the soul, and if warriors die ere they birth children, then that is that.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Even the brave warrior who finds a vessel will for many years remain a shadow of his former self. It falls to his elders to endure until he is ready to accept his responsibilities.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Ever will we meet our enemies in battle without fear. Such is our way, even when our numbers dwindle. If we die, so be it─but know that we fight to live, not to die.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Dotharl train and make ready for the day─but they do not rush to meet it. Not until we have done our duty.

dialogue.name: DOTHARL02511
dialogue.text: Sadu Khatun. Geser's body has been given to the sands.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Then our part is done. Rest, warrior. The Naadam draws near, and you will need your strength.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: If you intend to fight in the Naadam, you should return to the Mol and make ready. But know that when next we meet, you and yours will die. ...Or you could fight for us and live. Think on it, travelers.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: ...We shall. But if you would permit me a final question ere we part...where is this place that Geser has been lain to rest?

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Though I knew him not, I was there at his end. I wish to say a few words.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Rites for the flesh? I have heard of this. Madness, I say, for his body is of the earth now. He will not hear you.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: But you may speak to the sands, if that is your will. They lie to the west. Make haste, for the gedan may already have caught his scent.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: My apologies, Forename. This will take but a moment.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Return to your Mol, and die with them if that be your wish. But ware the ones in yellow as you go. They are fond of secrets and stratagems, and will not hesitate to involve you.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Well, then. We must all be on our way─even Geser.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Let us return to the Dawn Throne, and pray that our tale is enough to satisfy our “most radiant” taskmaster.
